summary:
About me 
I am a seasoned finance professional with strong stakeholder management skills and 15 years of experiences in the segments (consumer) industrial markets, trading and distribution and IT. Given my international leadership experience I bring not only a unique set of skills to every company, but also a broad knowledge of different work cultures. My experience with financial audits, financial planning, technical accounting, internal controls, due diligence and valuations is valuable to create clarity and shareholders value.

I aim to be on top of things and strive to provide excellent, on time and first-time right services to meet stakeholders’ needs. A goal-oriented team player with a positive and energetic personality. Open communication and focus on relationships are important values to me. I enjoy doing this together with my stakeholders and a team of staff.

Development of (young) professionals is an important driving force for me, manifesting in my role as Development Manager and as former board member of KPMG’s Young Professional Association Connect. I am coaching my team members by providing them with constructive feedback, training on the job and career development counseling. My leadership philosophy is that it is important to build a strong team, to mentor team members in achieving their career goals, making sure they are motivated and thrive at the intersection of their interests and capabilities.

Furthermore, I hold a Master of Science (MSc.) in Accountancy from one of Europe’s top business universities, Nyenrode Business Universiteit (Breukelen, Netherlands) and hold a Post Master Registeraccountant title (RA).

Specialties: Financial auditing - International Standards of Auditing/ US GAAS (SOX)/ IDW
Financial accounting - IFRSs/ Dutch GAAP/ German GAAP (HGB)

treasury_media.title: KPMG Business Destination Germany 2020
treasury_media.description: International investors are a significant pillar of Germany's economy and prosperity. There are more than 36 thousand companies in Germany that are owned by a foreign majority shareholder. This year's KPMG "Business Destination Germany 2020" survey analyzes for the third time how international investors in Germany assess the business landscape. In provides insights about Germany from the outside through the lens of foreign decision-makers.

treasury_media.title: KPMG - Studie - Business Destination Germany 2018
treasury_media.description: Deutschlands Unternehmen werden immer attraktiver. In den vergangenen fünf Jahren hat die Zahl der Fusionen und Übernahmen rasant zugenommen. Was bewegt ausländische Konzerne, ihr Kapital in Deutschland zu investieren? Wir haben 529 CFOs deutscher Tochterunternehmen von ausländischen Firmen dazu befragt. Ausländische Konzerne bewerten den Standort Deutschland.

treasury_media.title: KPMG's Business in Germany - November 2017
treasury_media.description: Useful insights on Germany as a business location with a focus on foreign investors.

treasury_media.title: From Germany to The Netherlands
treasury_media.description: The Netherlands offers numerous opportunities for German businesses. Just think of the prominent international gateways, or the favorable fiscal climate. KPMG’s German Desk can support you across the border, for example by helping bridge the culture and language gaps.

treasury_media.title: Establishing your business in The Netherlands
treasury_media.description:
With a central position in Europe, a stable economy, a reliable and equitable tax regime, a sophisticated and internationally oriented infrastructure, and a society and culture of openness, The Netherlands has an unparalleled position in Europe. As a global investor in The Netherlands, you need to fully understand
local market dynamics as well as the competitive environment you are operating in. In other words, you will require a partner with a global reach.

treasury_media.title: IFRS compared to Dutch GAAP
treasury_media.description: Een vergelijking tussen IFRS en de Nederlandse wet- en regelgeving (Dutch GAAP).
